page.title: 02Oxleas Wood
page.content: This covers much of Shooters Hill,which is the highest point in south-east London.It has been there for 9000 years.There are 3907 acres of woods but it used to cover 80 square miles. About 5000 people each week use the woods and open spaces to walk the dog, or to have a picnic. There are many species of fauna,like mole,hedgehog,shrew,rabbit,fox and grey squirrel.The woods are mostly oak,ash,beech,chestnut,but it has the rare wild service tree,which is one of the biggest in Britain.The woods are coppiced to encourage new growth and undergrowth which will attract more creatures. There is a very popular nature trail and orienteering course set out through the woods.
